raw_json.main_html:
Plotting Math in R

Posted on October 29, 2008 by Yu-Sung Su in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Yu-Sung Su's Blog, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

Plotting math in R can be acheived using the expression(). To know detailed usage, in R console,demo(plotmath)But expression() is not flexible when you want to plot math symbols and parameters altogether. In this case, we use bquote() which is actually a wraper for substitute() and quote(). It has the ability to do paste() and expression() altogether. Here is a simple example.k <- 2plot(1, main

Related
